{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sodium fluoroacetate is known to form fluorocitrate in the cells of aerobic organisms. Fluorocitrate is an inhibitor of aconitase, an enzyme involved in the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle. As a result, the TCA cycle is disrupted, leading to the accumulation of citrate in the cells. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Citrate.", "answer_choice": "B"}
